content.question: The polynomial function <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> is given by <math alttext="p open parentheses x close parentheses equals a x to the power of n plus 2 x cubed minus 4 x squared minus 8"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mi>n</mi></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math>, where <math alttext="a greater than 0"><mi>a</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></math> and <math alttext="n"><mi>n</mi></math> is an odd integer greater than <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math>. Which of the following describes the end behavior of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> ?

choices.label: As the input values of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> increase without bound, the output values can be described by <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow infinity of p open parentheses x close parentheses equals negative infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>.
As the input values of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> increase without bound, the output values increase without bound.

As the input values of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> decrease without bound, the output values can be described by <math alttext="limit as x rightwards arrow negative infinity of p open parentheses x close parentheses equals infinity"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>-</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>x</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mo>∞</mo></math>.

As the input values of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> decrease without bound, the output values get arbitrarily close to <math alttext="negative 8"><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math> and stay arbitrarily close to <math alttext="negative 8"><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn></math>.

content.answer: As the input values of <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> increase without bound, the output values increase without bound.
